title: How CS Lewis Deconstructs the recent Hit Pieces written against Jordan Peterson
description:
With the popularity of Jordan Peterson's "12 Rules for Life" there have been a spate of hit pieces done that try to undermine his credibility and his success. While engagement can be negative and even argumentative many of these pieces have been similar. https://www.alternet.org/news-amp-politics/rights-favorite-new-intellectual-has-some-truly-pitiable-ideas-about-masculinity 

I was struck when rereading Alan Jacob's terrific book "The Narnian" how similar these efforts are to what CS Lewis battled in the 1940s until his death in 1963. https://www.amazon.com/Narnian-Life-Imagination-C-S-Lewis/dp/B000BQYRE8/

Here's my conversation with Jonathan Pageau https://youtu.be/rxrtZuyPvFw
